metadata.Title: CVE-2019-20007 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in ezXML 0.8.2 through 0.8.6. The function ezxml_str2utf8, while parsing a crafted XML file, performs zero-length reallocation in ezxml.c, leading to returning a NULL pointer (in some compilers). After this, the function ezxml_parse_str does not check whether the s variable is not NULL in ezxml.c, leading to a NULL pointer dereference and crash (segmentation fault).

criterions.comment: mapcache: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
netcdf package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
scilab: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
